Title: Oz
Actors: Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Anthony Chisholm, B.D. Wong, Blake Robbins, Christopher Meloni, Chuck Zito, Dean Winters, Eamonn Walker, Edie Falco, Harold Perrineau Jr., Kathryn Erbe, Kirk Acevedo, Lee Tergesen, M, muMs, Philip Casnoff, Rob Bogue, Steven Wishnoff, Terry Kinney, Ernie Hudson, J.K. Simmons
Plot: Oz chronicles life inside an experimental cell block in the Oswald Maximum Security Correctional Facility: Level Four called Emerald City. Under unit manager Tim McManus and Warden Leo Glynn, the inmates in Em City all struggle to fulfill their own needs. Some fight for power; either power over the drug trade or power over the other inmate factions. Others want money, either through slinging 'tits' (drugs), gambling or other scams. Others, Corrections officers and inmates alike, simply want to survive long enough to make parole or even to see tomorrow. The show gives a no-holds-barred account of prison life with all the plots, subplots and conflicts given context and explanation by the show's wheelchair-bound narrator, Augustus Hill.
